Pre-Game Insights: Australia needed to execute the perfect mugging of Afghanistan to boost their net run rate for the tournament ahead of England’s match.
Post-Match Reflections: Rashid Khan showed his frustration after narrowly failing to guide Afghanistan to victory.
In terms of having an effect on the group, Afghanistan might well live in Australian memories as the team that knocked them out of their home World Cup.
Now they are asking Sri Lanka to return the favour after the Australians visited crisis-hit Sri Lanka last June.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia’s fate is now in other hands, with their only path to the semi-finals requiring a Sri Lanka win over England on Saturday.
Afghanistan’s performance was impressive, as they qualified directly for this tournament in the top eight, and denied a chance to strut their stuff at the MCG by two washouts.
T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12s: Australia beat Afghanistan by four runs – as it happened
